com.mygdx.game

Class GameScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mygdx.game.GameScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

    public class GameScreen
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    The GameScreen class is used to display the main character sprite's movement, as well as render the maps and collision for the game. The class also includes a render of a custom made map, as well as drawings of sprites. All of this is done on a single screen. A looping method as well as a series of if statements (to check for collision) are used to allow the sprite to traverse the screen. It takes a 'sprite sheet', which is a grid of animation frames, and splits it into a 2D array of type TextureRegion, which is then made into a 1D array of the same type. That array, in conjunction with the built in Animation class, is used to animate the sprite's walking cycle. For-each loops are used to render the collision rectangles for the custom map files, as well as for the map properties.
    Version:
    4.0 08.06.2016

    Instance Variables

    animation_right Instance of Animation class used to animate right walking cycle

    animation_left Instance of Animation class used to animate left walking cycle

    animation_up Instance of Animation class used to animate up walking cycle

    animation_down Instance of Animation class used to animate down walking cycle

    boulder_down Instance of Animation class used to animate down rolling cycle

    boulder_right Instance of Animation class used to animate right rolling cycle

    frames_left TextureRegion array used to store frames for left walk cycle

    frames_down TextureRegion array used to store frames for down walk cycle

    roller_down TextureRegion array used to store frames for down roll cycle

    roller_right TextureRegion array used to store frames for right roll cycle

    boulderArr ArrayList of Rectangle used to store boulder locations and properties

    boulderXArr ArrayList of Integer used to store x-coordinates of all boulders on the map

    boulderYArr ArrayList of Integer used to store y-coordinates of all boulders on the map

    distanceArr ArrayList of Integer used to store max distance traveled of all boulders on the map

    directionArr ArrayList of String used to store direction of boulder travel of all boulders on the map

    mapList ArrayList of TiledMap used to store game maps

    totalTime float value representing total time user took to complete the level

    interpY float value representing y-coord of interp collision box

    indianaX float value used to store x-coord of main sprite

    indianaY float value used to store y-coord of main sprite

    speed float value used to determine move speed of main sprite (pixels per second)

    time float value used to store duration of a frame (used for animation)

    direction String value representing direction of player movement

    name String value representing user's name

    paused boolean value used to determine if game is paused

    priority boolean value used to determine whether or not priorityDraw() method is called

    gameEnded boolean value used to determine if game has ended

    catched boolean value used to determine if cursor is visible

    retrieved boolean value used to determine if treasure has been retrieved

    timeSeconds int value representing amount of time elapsed

    difficulty int value representing the level difficulty

    b Instance of Boulder class used to update and draw boulder locations

    desertMusic Instance of Music used to stream music

    earthMusic Instance of Music used to stream music

    iceMusic Instance of Music used to stream music

    timerFont Instance of BitmapFont used to display custom windows fonts for the timer.

    dialogFont Instance of BitmapFont used to display custom windows fonts for dialog boxes.

    Author:
    Brian Tran

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private boolean collidesWithBoulders()
      This method determines if the user collides with any boulder located on the map.
      private boolean collidesWithMap()
      This method uses a for loop and an if statement to determine if the user's walking hitbox collides with the map boundaries.
      private void createMap()
      This method is responsible for rendering the map, and resetting all of the array values (such as collision array and boulder array).
      void dispose()
      This method disposes of all unused resources in order to prevent more memory from being taken up.
      private void drawOverlay()
      This method draws the game ending overlay, which happens when the user has completed the final stage of the difficulty.
      private void endCheck()
      This method checks if the user has ended the stage or level.
      private void gameUpdate()
      The gameUpdate method takes in user input and updates the player's current location based on the keys the user enters.
      void hide()
      This method calls the dispose method once the screen has been changed.
      private boolean mapEnds()
      This method determines if the player collides with the end point of the level.
      private void musicPlay()
      This method plays different music files based on the difficulty of the level.
      private void occupyArray(java.lang.String path)
      The occupyArray method adds TileMaps to the TileMap ArrayList.
      void pause()
      Unused overridden method.
      private void priorityDraw()
      The priority draw method is called every render loop.
      void render(float delta)
      The render() method is an overridden method from the GDX library.
      void resize(int width, int height)
      Unused overridden method.
      void resume()
      Unused overridden method.
      private void saveGame()
      This method calls the save method in the SaveManager class from the MainGame class.
      private void setCurrentMap(int index)
      The setCurrentMap method sets the current game map based on the user's entered difficulty.
      void show()
      The show() method is an overridden method from the Screen interface.
      private boolean treasureRetrieved()
      This method determines if the user has collected the treasure item or not.

        batch - SpriteBatch used for rendering screen elements
        game - MainGame used for switching between screens
        name - String used for username storage
        difficulty - int used for difficulty selection
        timeSeconds - int used for time storage

      • show

        public void show()
        The show() method is an overridden method from the Screen interface. This method is run once at the beginning of the application run time. This method is used to create and initialize variables as well as run settings that should be run at the beginning of the application, such as the playing of music. First and second for loop is used to fill the texture region arrays with images from the spritesheet to be used for animation.
        Specified by:
        show in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

      • render

        public void render(float delta)
        The render() method is an overridden method from the GDX library. The render method is run every frame, and as a result, updates the screen every frame with new information. This allows for animations of sprites and such to be easier. Things are displayed on the screen using a SpriteBatch, which acts as a container of sorts for the screen elements. First if statement is used to save the game state when the keyboard shortcut Ctrl + S is used. Second if statement is used to increment the timer when the game is not paused or finished. Third if structure is used to update the game whenever it is not paused. If it is paused, this if statement draws the pause overlay. First for loop draws all of the boulders when the game is paused. Fourth if statement is used to save the game when the Save button is clicked. Fifth if statement is used to quit to the main menu when the quit button is pressed. Sixth if statement is used to resume the game when the back button is pressed. Seventh if statement is used to resume the game when the escape key is pressed while the game is in pause state. Eighth if statement is used to draw the treasure item if the map properties state that the map contains one. Ninth if statement closes the game if the user presses the CTRL + W shortcut.
        Specified by:
        render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

      • gameUpdate

        private void gameUpdate()
        The gameUpdate method takes in user input and updates the player's current location based on the keys the user enters. This method is called everytime the render method runs, as long as the game is not in a paused state. First for loop is used to update every boulder with the Boulder class, and to reset and draw the boulders in their new locations. First if statement is used to determine which boulder animation to use if the boulder direction is "up". Second if statement reverses the animation if needed. Third if statement is used to determine which boulder animation to use if the boulder direction is "down". Fourth if statement reverses the animation if needed. Fifth if statement is used to determine which boulder animation to use if the boulder direction is "left". Sixth if statement reverses the animation if needed. Seventh if statement determines what boulder animation to use if the boulder direction is "right". Eighth if statement is used to reverse the animation if needed. Ninth if statement is used to respawn the player if they collide with a boulder. Tenth if statement is used to set the retrieved boolean to true if the player has retrieved the treasure item. Eleventh if statement is used to set paused boolean to true and to set mouse cursor to catched if the escape key is pressed. Twelfth if statement is used to determine actions that are performed if the D key or the right arrow key is pressed. Thirteenth if statement updates player location as long as they don't collide with the map. Fourteenth if statement resets player location if the collide with outer map boundaries. Fifteenth if statement sets player movement direction to right. Sixteenth if statement determines actions to be performed if the A key or the left arrow key is pressed. Seventeenth if statement updates player location as long as they don't collide with the map. Eighteenth if statement resets player location if they collide with the outer map boundaries. Nineteenth if statement sets player direction to left. Twentieth if statement determines actions to be performed if the S key or the down arrow key is pressed. Twenty-first if statement updates player location as long as they don't collide with the map. Twenty-second if statement resets player location if they collide with the outer map boundaries. Twenty-third if statement sets the player direction to down. Twenty-fourth if statement determines actions to be performed if the W key or the up arrow key is pressed. Twenty-fifth if statement updates player location as long as they don't collide with the map. Twenty-sixth if statement resets player location if they collide with outer map boundaries. Twenty-seventh if statement sets the player direction to up. Twenty-eighth if statement sets player direction to none. Twenty-ninth if statement saves the game and resets timer/direction values if the player completes the game.

      • collidesWithMap

        private boolean collidesWithMap()
        This method uses a for loop and an if statement to determine if the user's walking hitbox collides with the map boundaries. If the user collides with the map, a result of true is returned. First for loop runs through the array of collision rectangles. First if statement determines if the player collides with any of the collision rectangles.
        Returns:
        result boolean based on if player collides with map

      • mapEnds

        private boolean mapEnds()
        This method determines if the player collides with the end point of the level. First if statement determines if the player's hitbox rectangle collides with the rectangle of the end location.
        Returns:
        result Boolean based on if the player collides with end point

      • priorityDraw

        private void priorityDraw()
        The priority draw method is called every render loop. This method ensures, through a series of if statements, that if the user inputs multiple keys at once, only the first key's animation will play, instead of having multiple walking animations play at the same time. First if statement draws the up animation if the direction of the player is up. Second if statement draws the down animation if the direction of the player is down. Third if statement draws the left animation if the direction of the player is left. Fourth if statement draws the right animation if the direction of the player is right. Fifth if statement draws a still image if the direction of the player is none.

      • hide

        public void hide()
        This method calls the dispose method once the screen has been changed.
        Specified by:
        hide in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

      • occupyArray

        private void occupyArray(java.lang.String path)
        The occupyArray method adds TileMaps to the TileMap ArrayList. This allows for easy traversing through each of the maps.
        Parameters:
        path - Path of the map file.

      • setCurrentMap

        private void setCurrentMap(int index)
        The setCurrentMap method sets the current game map based on the user's entered difficulty. It does this with an index variable used to traverse the ArrayList of maps.
        Parameters:
        index - integer used to traverse ArrayList

      • endCheck

        private void endCheck()
        This method checks if the user has ended the stage or level. If the stage that the user has completed is not the final stage of the difficulty, a new map (the last stage) is loaded. If the stage that the user has completed is the final stage of the difficulty, a game winning overlay with the user's name and score is displayed and the game is saved. First if statement determines if the user has completed the level. Second if statement determines the actions to be performed if the stage the user has completed was the first stage of the difficulty. Third if statement draws the overlay and sets gameEnded to true if the map does not contain a treasure or if the treasure has been retrieved.

      • saveGame

        private void saveGame()
        This method calls the save method in the SaveManager class from the MainGame class. The method stores the user's name, the difficulty of the stage they are currently on, and the total time that has elapsed.

      • drawOverlay

        private void drawOverlay()
        This method draws the game ending overlay, which happens when the user has completed the final stage of the difficulty. This game ending overlay contains the user's name within a dialog box as well as the time it took for the user to complete the entire difficulty level. The first if statement determines what actions to be performed when the user's cursor is over the menu button. The second if statement changes the game screen to the main menu if the user clicks their mouse while the cursor is over the menu button. The third if statement determines what actions to be performed when the user's cursor is over the go button. The fourth if statement renders the new map and resets values when the user clicks their mouse while the cursor is over the go button. The fifth if statement determine actions to occur based on whether the level they completed is the last one or not.

      • createMap

        private void createMap()
        This method is responsible for rendering the map, and resetting all of the array values (such as collision array and boulder array). This method is used for when a new map is switched. The first for loop occupies the collision array with rectangles taken from the map file. The first if statement determines if the current object is a Rectangle. If so, it is added to the collision array. The second for loop runs through the map objects that represent the start and end points in the map file. The second if statement determines if the object is an Ellipse. If so, the start value is set to the Ellipse. The third if statement determines if the object is a Rectangle. If so, the end value is set to the Rectangle. The fourth if statement resets the retrieved value to false if the map contains a treasure item.

      • musicPlay

        private void musicPlay()
        This method plays different music files based on the difficulty of the level. The first if statement plays the desert theme if the user is on the first difficulty. The second if statement plays the earth theme if the user is on the second difficulty. The third if statement plays the ice theme if the user is on the third difficulty.

      • collidesWithBoulders

        private boolean collidesWithBoulders()
        This method determines if the user collides with any boulder located on the map. The first for loop runs through the array of rectangles that represent the boulder hitboxes. The first if statement returns true if the player's hitbox collides with that of the boulder's.
        Returns:
        result Boolean based on if the user collides with a boulder

      • treasureRetrieved

        private boolean treasureRetrieved()
        This method determines if the user has collected the treasure item or not. The first if statement determines if the user has collided with the rectangle representing the treasure item.
        Returns:
        result Boolean based on if the user collided with treasure item
